result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew D Briggs

records.addlTxt:
2:01 PM Defendant Matthew D Briggs in court.  Prosecuting attorney Robin W Lee in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim Breanna B appeared by phone.  Defendant is hiring private counsel, but would like more time to pay for attorney.
Status conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on September 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

CASH BAIL PREVIOUSLY POSTED OF $1,000 TO BE APPLIED TO THIS BOND. 
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required. 
- Defendant shall not have any in-person contact with Breanna B. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Breanna B except only regarding their shared children. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with parents of Breanna B. 
- Defendant shall not be in the 2400 block of Erickson St in Stoughton. 
- Defendant shall not be be within 1,000 feet of Breanna B. 
- The Court finds substantial evidence that knowing and malicious prevention or dissuasion of the above victim(s) is reasonably likely to occur. The above conditions of release are hereby ordered pursuant to Sec. 940.47 and Chapter 969. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 5

08:38 AM Defendant appeared.  Trisha L Simmons appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Appearance by victim. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Statement by victim.  Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
